title: Static Analysis

android.permission.INTERNET.description: Allows an application to create network sockets.

android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE.description: Allows an application to view the status of all networks.

android.permission.WAKE_LOCK.description: Allows an application to prevent the phone from going to sleep.

certificate_findings: Application is signed with a code signing certificate
Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android <7.0

manifest_analysis.title:
Application Data can be Backed up
[android:allowBackup=true]
manifest_analysis.desc: This flag allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.
manifest_analysis.name: Application Data can be Backed up [android:allowBackup=true]

manifest_analysis.title:
Service (com.skip.video.ads.AdsAccessibilityService) is Protected by a permission, but the protection level of the permission should be checked.
Permission: android.permission.BIND_ACCESSIBILITY_SERVICE
[android:exported=true]
manifest_analysis.desc: A Service is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. It is protected by a permission which is not defined in the analysed application. As a result, the protection level of the permission should be checked where it is defined. If it is set to normal or dangerous, a malicious application can request and obtain the permission and interact with the component. If it is set to signature, only applications signed with the same certificate can obtain the permission.
manifest_analysis.name: is Protected by a permission, but the protection level of the permission should be checked.[android:exported=true]

metadata.description: The App logs information. Sensitive information should never be logged.
metadata.cwe: CWE-532 Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File

metadata.description: App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.

metadata.cwe: CWE-327 Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
metadata.description: MD5 is a weak hash known to have hash collisions.
The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator.
metadata.cwe: CWE-330 Use of Insufficiently Random Values

metadata.description: App uses SQLite Database and execute raw SQL query. Untrusted user input in raw SQL queries can cause SQL Injection. Also sensitive information should be encrypted and written to the database.
metadata.cwe: CWE-89 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

metadata.description: The App uses ECB mode in Cryptographic encryption algorithm. ECB mode is known to be weak as it results in the same ciphertext for identical blocks of plaintext.
metadata.cwe: CWE-327 Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

metadata.description: Insecure WebView Implementation. Execution of user controlled code in WebView is a critical Security Hole.
metadata.cwe: CWE-749 Exposed Dangerous Method or Function

FCS_RBG_EXT.1.1.choice: The application invoke platform-provided DRBG functionality for its cryptographic operations.

FCS_STO_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not store any credentials to non-volatile memory.

FCS_CKM_EXT.1.1.choice: The application implement asymmetric key generation.

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has access to ['network connectivity'].

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.2.choice: The application has access to no sensitive information repositories.

FDP_NET_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has user/application initiated network communications.

FDP_DAR_EXT.1.1.choice: The application implement functionality to encrypt sensitive data in non-volatile memory.

FMT_MEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application invoke the mechanisms recommended by the platform vendor for storing and setting configuration options.

FTP_DIT_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does encrypt some transmitted data with HTTPS/TLS/SSH between itself and another trusted IT product.

FCS_RBG_EXT.2.1,FCS_RBG_EXT.2.2.choice: The application perform all deterministic random bit generation (DRBG) services in accordance with NIST Special Publication 800-90A using Hash_DRBG. The deterministic RBG is seeded by an entropy source that accumulates entropy from a platform-based DRBG and a software-based noise source, with a minimum of 256 bits of entropy at least equal to the greatest security strength (according to NIST SP 800-57) of the keys and hashes that it will generate.

FCS_CKM.1.1(1).choice: The application generate asymmetric cryptographic keys not in accordance with FCS_CKM.1.1(1) using key generation algorithm RSA schemes and cryptographic key sizes of 1024-bit or lower.

FCS_COP.1.1(1).choice: The application perform encryption/decryption not in accordance with FCS_COP.1.1(1), AES-ECB mode is being used.

FCS_COP.1.1(2).choice: The application perform cryptographic hashing services not in accordance with FCS_COP.1.1(2) and uses the cryptographic algorithm RC2/RC4/MD4/MD5.

FCS_HTTPS_EXT.1.1.choice: The application implement the HTTPS protocol that complies with RFC 2818.

FCS_HTTPS_EXT.1.2.choice: The application implement HTTPS using TLS.

playstore_details.title: Skip Ads
playstore_details.description:
This application allow to automatically remove and mute fullscreen Ads from all your applications.

Supported advertisers:

- AdMob 
- AppLovin
- Facebook Audience Network
- IronSource
- AdColony

Partly supported or not supported
- Rewarded Videos
- Native ads
- TapJoy - not verified
- Vungle - not verified
- LiftOff

To check the advertiser in your application use Ads Detector
playstore_details.recentChanges: Automatically remove and mute fullscreen Ads (AdMob) from all your applications
playstore_details.recentChangesHTML: Automatically remove and mute fullscreen Ads (AdMob) from all your applications
